Award.AwardTitle: NSF Travel Grant Support for ACM Conference on Security and Privacy in Wireless and Mobile Networks 2020 (ACM WiSec)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration: This proposal supports student travel to attend the 2020 ACM Conference on Security and Privacy in Wireless and Mobile Networks (ACM WiSec) to be held in Linz, Austria from July 8-10, 2020. The ACM WiSec conference is a leading venue for quick and wide dissemination of cutting-edge research results in on the security and privacy of wireless communications and mobile networks. This travel grant enables career development and learning opportunities for US-based and/or US citizen graduate students. Attending conferences is an important component of graduate school education for our society's future computer security researchers. Students have the opportunity to discuss leading edge research with world-class computer security researchers, and establish networks, connections, and mentoring relationships that will serve them well during their research careers.<br/><br/>This grant provides travel support to encourage participation in the 2020 ACM Conference on Security and Privacy in Wireless and Mobile Networks by students who would normally find it difficult to attend. Criteria for selection include evidence of a serious interest in the field, as demonstrated by research output, coursework and/or project experience. Organizers encourage participation of women and students from other under-represented groups.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 15th ACM Conference on Security and Privacy in Wireless and Mobile Networks (ACM WiSec 2022) took place as an in-person conference from May 16 to May 19, 2022 in San Antonio, Texas, USA. This project provided travel grant awards for 14 US-based graduate students to attend the conference, which aimed to expose them to leading-edge research in the field, as well as to interact with senior researchers from industry and academia. Participation of women and under-represented minorities is especially encouraged.


WiSec is one of the leading international conferences on the security and privacy of wireless communications and mobile networks. Every year, researchers present novel ideas and fundamental advances in areas including location privacy, anonymity, security of smartphones, jamming attacks and defenses, and usable mobile security.  This travel grant provided the opportunity for students to present their own work, attend panel and keynote speech sessions, interact with peers and senior researchers, and expose themselves to leading-edge work in the fields of wireless networks security and mobile privacy. Funds that could not be spent in 2020 were used to support students for ACM WiSec 2022. This is because the conference was held remotely in 2020 and 2021 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.


Overall, the travel grant provided an important opportunity for students to expand their horizon, and contributed to the promotion of diversity in the field by encouraging the participation of women and other underrepresented minorities.
